docs.snippet: The nationwide suspension of the messaging service ended a day after a lower court judge ordered it in a quest for information in a criminal case....
docs.lead_paragraph: The nationwide suspension of the messaging service ended a day after a lower court judge ordered it in a quest for information in a criminal case.
docs.abstract: Brazilian judge lifts nationwide suspension of WhatsApp messaging service, which was blocked after Facebook-owned service did not comply with requests for data related to organized crime and drug trafficking case.

headline.main: Brazilian Judge Lifts Suspension of WhatsApp

byline.contributor: Mike Isaac contributed reporting from San Francisco.

docs.snippet: Experts in neuroscience, genetics and social work discussed emerging research on what happens to a child’s brain before it is fully formed, and how children who seem broken can be made whole....
docs.lead_paragraph: Experts in neuroscience, genetics and social work discussed emerging research on what happens to a child’s brain before it is fully formed, and how children who seem broken can be made whole.
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines negative effect of environmental stress and poverty on developing brains, particularly in context of New York City school children exposed to abuse and dysfunction; notes efforts of experts panel called Poverty, the Brain and Mental Health, which provides social services in New York's schools.

headline.main: Studying How Poverty Keeps Hurting Young Minds, and What to Do About It
headline.print_headline: How Poverty Keeps Hurting Young Minds

docs.snippet: In a story May 4 about a campaign to legalize marijuana in California, The Associated Press misspelled the surname of the state's lieutenant governor in one reference. He is Gavin Newsom, not Newson....
